summary: The Critical Minerals Partnership Act of 2025 aims to secure critical mineral supply chains, primarily through international cooperation. It authorizes the President to negotiate agreements with international partners to build resilient supply chains, facilitate mining, processing, and recycling. The bill establishes policy goals to reduce reliance on adversaries, prioritize domestic development, and implement market-based incentives. It also authorizes US participation in the Minerals Security Partnership, establishing a database and prioritizing projects that advance national and economic security. Furthermore, it authorizes US membership and financial contributions to the International Nickel Study Group.
